blogs.title: Poems starring mathematicians - 6 (Mandelbrot)
blogs.summary: More familiar than the name Benoit Mandelbrot are images, like the one to the left, of the fractal that bears his name.  Born in Poland (1924) and educated in France, Mandelbrot moved to the US in 1958 to join the research staff at IBM. A fractal is a roug

author.name: Intersections -- Poetry with Mathematics
author.description: Mathematical language can heighten the imagery of a poem; mathematical structure can deepen its effect.  Feast here on an international menu of poems made rich by mathematical ingredients.

blogs.summary:
From Descartes to Curie to the Oxford English Dictionary, a biblio-anatomy of an unrepeatable mind.

wikipedia.title: Pattern
wikipedia.summary: A pattern, apart from the term's use to mean "Template", is a discernible regularity in the world or in a manmade design.
